posts.post_content:
Probably the most overpriced card in the history of this game (been playing since end of Revised). I mean she's good, but she's not $60 good.  
  
Insane what people will pay for a card that is a 4.250 at best, going by this obtuse rating system (don't get me started on that topic)  
  
What happened to common sense and actually being able to evaluate a card?  
  
Oh well, let the suckers pay $60 a pop for her. I'll save my money for cards actually worth that price tag, which I have done many times over and for a lot more than $60. (i.e Black Lotus, Set Of Moxes, Time Walk, Ancestral Recall, Timetwister, Time Vault)  
  
But this? Boggles my mind TOTALLY.  
  
And before anybody tells me that I don't know beans about cards or this game, I've got a collection of over 35,000 cards and have seen and played just about all of them, along with their price tags at peak. No card ever cost this much and did relatively so little. And please don't tell me the original dual lands from the early sets. I got them for $... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: DragonicSphinx (9/23/2011 10:35:58 PM)

posts.post_content:
I love her. Drop her on turn 3 and +1 your [Vengeful Pharoah](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengeful Pharoah) and you've got free removal each turn that she lives, as well as a way to keep their stored cards down. That's some attrition I can live with. She still has her -2 ability in case you absolutely can't deal with one of their creatures, due to Hexproof or whatnot.  
  
And that +6... <3

Posted By: NegFactor (9/23/2011 3:11:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
What I think that makes her so good is that she's a real utility planeswalker, much like Jace 2.0 was (except not so broken, at least not for now). She is incredibly efficient while you're building up her loyalty - her +1 gives you a big card advantage if you build around it (flashback and other ways of graveyard recursion, of which Innistrad is full, for example), all while still having an impressive ultimate (speaking on which, I can't figure out how would be the best way to divide his permanents - lands in one pile and creatures in another, maybe).
  
Also, costing 3 really helps her a lot - starting to build up her loyalty in turn 3 is a lot of win. And doing that on turn 1 with dark ritual is just mean.
  
I've had an encounter with her in my second Innistrad booster (from the 2 I bought). But, judging by the comments here, 1/3 of all people seem to have found her in the first 2 boosters as well. Seriously, that doesn't seem probable, with it being a Mythic and all that. But what do ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Lash_of_Dragonbreath (10/6/2011 1:41:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
She's good, but not $70 good. And she's certainly not $70 good this early in the block, since there really aren't that many fun things to dump in your graveyard yet.   
  
Unless you're just using her as a $70 edict, she's a build-around-me card. Like Tezzeret, she needs support cards to take advantage of her abilities, and one reanimation spell and a 7 CMC dig spell aren't quite cutting it for me. Personally, I'll just play Tezzeret--who *does* have an entire block to support his abilities (and can actually kill my opponent)--and pick up my playset of Lilly after the price crashes in two months.
posts.html:

Posted By: Hayw00d0909 (10/14/2011 6:23:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Liliana of the Veil seems like an amazing card if for her +1 ability alone. Build a deck around that and you got card advantage coming out of your but hole, throw in some burial rights and sun titan and you start hurting things...a lot.  
Splash some blue with a pinch of flashback cards and your are winning games.  
  
I like Liliana, and although black is not my think, I'm changing my opinion fast. However there are a couple easy things that can get rid of her and her flaws.  
1) other graveyard decks. If you are playing the mirror match, or you are up against splinterfright you may be in for some dissapointment...  
2) Beast within seems like a fast counter to Liliana and if they are using her they are likely using control variant, which mean there is little they can do with that 3/3 beast anyway.  
3) Brimstone folley covers her well early game and late game doing five damage.  
4) white has the use of nevermore and other other strange ways of dealing with Liliana but no-one plays mono-white so y... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: I have made a deck that already takes advantage of her. I can kick of her ultimate mulitple times in game just for the fact BW Decks are really good at control. Mirran Cruaders and Phyrexian crusaders with her are really mean which is another feature to combo with her but I really like the fact that I have my play set of her. But I still have to admit she is really expensive at the moment for most people to use so she will either pull a gideon or a Jace 2.0 and start out expensive and go down or just stay expensive.
